torch.save won't take a BytesIO object.

>>> import torch
>>> from io import BytesIO
>>> bio = BytesIO()
>>> torch.save(torch.nn.Linear(10,1).state_dict(), bio)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/<>/.installs/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/home/<>/.installs/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 192, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: _write_file couldn't retrieve a file descriptor from given object

You can pickle the state_dict to a buffer and send it in, say, a post request, but the receiving end can't use torch.load and the map_location feature

body:
`torch.save` won't take a BytesIO object.
```
>>> import torch
>>> from io import BytesIO
>>> bio = BytesIO()
>>> torch.save(torch.nn.Linear(10,1).state_dict(), bio)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/<>/.installs/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 120, in save
    return _save(obj, f, pickle_module, pickle_protocol)
  File "/home/<>/.installs/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 192, in _save
    serialized_storages[key]._write_file(f)
RuntimeError: _write_file couldn't retrieve a file descriptor from given object
```
You can pickle the `state_dict` to a buffer and send it in, say, a post request, but the receiving end can't use `torch.load` and the `map_location` feature
